discussion.author: goerz
discussion.text:
> Lowercase package name juliac contains the string "julia".

I'd vote for an exception to that rule being made for this package! ;-)

[noblock]

discussion.author: goerz
discussion.text:
Although I might just throw out there that `JuliaCompiler` could be an even more "Julian" package name, leading by example with respect to the ["Err on the side of clarity" guideline](https://julialang.github.io/Pkg.jl/dev/creating-packages/#Package-naming-guidelines-1). That "clarity" rule really seems like it's becoming the main guiding principle for new registrations, by wide consensus of the registry maintainers. The package would, of course, still be providing the `juliac` command line interface.

Not that I think that a package so "core" as this one is necessarily bound by the same considerations as other packages in the wider ecosystem.

[noblock]

discussion.author: JeffBezanson
discussion.text: We considered `JuliaCompiler` but that really makes it sound like it implements a compiler, which it doesn't. Maybe `JuliaCompilerDriver`? The name of the package doesn't matter so much, the script name `juliac` is what's important so the package name could be longer/clearer.

discussion.author: GunnarFarneback
discussion.text: Assuming that the `juliac` script gets wide use, the discoverability benefits from the package having the same name (modulo capitalization).

discussion.author: fredrikekre
discussion.text: Perhaps `juliac` then? There are already non-jll packages with all lowercase letters, e.g. https://github.com/JuliaRegistries/General/blob/master/J/jlpkg/Package.toml

discussion.author: JeffBezanson
discussion.text: Oh in that case I would vote for just `juliac`.

discussion.author: gbaraldi
discussion.text: I don't like the no caps capitalization. If I tell someone to install JuliaC.jl they will assume that it's written like every other julia package. The only non caps packages i've seen are jlls which follow naming from non julia things

discussion.author: Keno
discussion.text: Let's just do JuliaC and move on - nobody will ever use this as a dependency and that's just the way we spell these.
